code: @Manual{,   title = {pytourr: Interactive tourrs using python},   author = {Matthias Medl},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mmedl94.github.io/pytourr/}, }

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: package extension tourr R-package. general overview tourr package please refer tourr documentation. pytourr adds interactive displays functionality tourr allowing users direct path tours.

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: can install development version pytourr github :

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: run interactive tour first initialize python backend can display saved tour objects, scatterplots histograms interactive_tour()
code: library(pytourr) init_env() library(tourr) data <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) clusters <- as.numeric(flea$species) flea_subspecies <- unique(flea$species)  guided_tour_history <- save_history(data,                                     tour_path = guided_tour(holes())) grand_tour_history_1d <- save_history(data,                                       tour_path = grand_tour(d=1))  half_range <- max(sqrt(rowSums(f^2))) feature_names <- colnames(f)  init_env()  obj1 <- list(type = "2d_tour", obj = guided_tour_history) obj2 <- list(type = "1d_tour", obj = grand_tour_history_1d) obj3 <- list(type = "scatter", obj = c("tars1", "tars2")) obj4 <- list(type = "hist", obj = "head")  interactive_tour(data=data,                  plot_objects=list(obj1, obj2, obj3, obj4),                  feature_names=feature_names,                  half_range = half_range,                  n_plot_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters,                  preselection_names=flea_subspecies,                  n_subsets = 5                  display_size=5)

what: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
text: Initialize anaconda environment used python backend

title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
text: env_name string defines name python environment reticulate uses. can useful one wants use preinstalled python environment. virtual_env either "virtual_env" "anaconda". "virtual_env" creates virtual environment, advantage GUI looks much nicer previous python installation required,setup environment can error prone. "anaconda" installs python environment via Anaconda, can stable, GUI looks dated.

title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
code: init_env(env_name="r-pytourr", virtual_env = "virtual_env") #> Installing pyenv ... #> Done! pyenv has been installed to '/home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv'. #> + /home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv update #> + /home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv install --skip-existing 3.10.12 #> Using Python: /home/runner/.pyenv/versions/3.10.12/bin/python3.10 #> Creating virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ...  #> + /home/runner/.pyenv/versions/3.10.12/bin/python3.10 -m venv /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr #> Done! #> Installing packages: pip, wheel, setuptools #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade pip wheel setuptools #> Installing packages: numpy #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user numpy #> Virtual environment 'r-pytourr' successfully created. #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user pandas #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user matplotlib #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user customtkinter #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user statsmodels #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user seaborn #> Python environment "r-pytourr" successfully loaded

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
code: interactive_tour(   data,   plot_objects,   feature_names,   half_range,   n_plot_cols,   preselection = FALSE,   preselection_names = FALSE,   n_subsets = 3,   display_size = 5 )

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
text: data dataset want investigate plot_objects named list objects want displayed. entry requires definition type display specification plotted. feature_names names features dataset half_range factor influences scaling displayed tour plots. Small values lead spread datapoints (might fit plotting area), large values lead data compact. provided good estimate calculated used. n_plot_cols specifies number columns grid final display. preselection vector specifies subset datapoint put initially. preselection_names vector specifies names preselection subsets n_subsets total number available subsets (10). display_size rough size subplot inches

what: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: Modification render_proj() function tourr half_range calculated max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) can provided arg

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
code: render_proj_inter(   data,   prj,   half_range = NULL,   axis_labels = NULL,   obs_labels = NULL,   limits = 1,   position = "center" )

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: data matrix, data frame containing numeric columns, standardised mean 0, sd 1 prj projection matrix axis_labels axes displayed obs_labels labels observations available interactive mouseover limits value setting lower upper limits projected data, default 1 position position axes: center (default), bottomleft

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: list containing projected data, circle segments axes

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
code: data(flea) #> Warning: data set ‘flea’ not found flea_std <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'flea' not found prj <- basis_random(ncol(flea[,1:6]), 2) #> Error in basis_random(ncol(flea[, 1:6]), 2): could not find function "basis_random" p <- render_proj(flea_std, prj) #> Error in render_proj(flea_std, prj): could not find function "render_proj"
